A Method for Monsters Neutreal to Tablets
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Raising/Training Methods: Assorted Other Specialty Methods: A Method for Monsters Neutreal to Tablets
By Battle Fencer on Monday, June 17, 2002 - 12:45 pm:

While I was usine the Energizer Bunny Method 4, I stopped and figured out a way to escape a lifespan hit and let it work on monsters that are neutreal to tablets.

The method works best at prime for that the monsters stats reach their peak. Also, this method starts at week 4 and is a 2-month cycle.

Week 4: Candy =0,0 HD- 20,10

Tablet: 20,0

Week 1: nuts oil =0,0 HD- 20,10

Week 2: mint leaf=20,5 LD- 30,10

Week 3: nuts oil =2,10 HD- 22,20

Week 4: mint leaf=22,10 LD- 32,15

Tablet: 32,2

Week 1: nuts oil =5,2 HD- 25,12

Week 2: candy =25,12 RT- 0,2-7

Week 3: mint leaf=0,1-4 RT- 0,0

Repeat.

This method takes off 1 hard drill for a rest but it should be worth it because you wont have any lifespan hits and about the same number of hard drills.

If I made a mistake somewhere, please post them.

By Battle Fencer on Monday, June 17, 2002 - 12:48 pm:

In month 2, week 3, you can exchange the mint leaf for any item since the last rest will autimatically lower your stress to 0.

By The D on Monday, June 17, 2002 - 12:54 pm:

A couple things I see wrong with this. First, your not using the HD, LD math correctly.

HD = +15 Fatigue, +12 Stress
LD = +10 Fatigue, +5 Stress

Second your not using the lifeloss/lifespan thing correct. In order to figure out if you lost life or stress, etc. Use:

Fatigue + (Stress x 2) = Whatever the number.

Use this to figure out the lost life (if there is).

Other than this, Good method man.

By Battle Fencer on Monday, June 17, 2002 - 01:01 pm:

Whoops. I'll repost it.

By Battle Fencer on Monday, June 17, 2002 - 01:20 pm:

Week 4: mint leaf=0,0 HD- 15,12

Tablet: 15,0

Week 1: nuts oil =0,0 HD- 15,12

Week 2: mint leaf=15,6 LD- 25,11

Week 3: nuts oil =0,11 HD- 15,23

Week 4: mint leaf=15,12 LD- 25,17

Tablet: 25,4

Week 1: nuts oil =0,4 HD- 15,16

Week 2: candy =15,16 RT- 0,6-11

Week 3: mint leaf=0,3-5 RT- 0,0

Repeat.

I just changed the item used in week 1, month 1. It should be mint leaf so that the monster will have comletely no stress,hopefull, and will redo the course over.

For The lifespan index, here it goes:

Week 4: 0

Week 1: 39

Week 2: 45

Week 3: 61 (oh-oh. Don't scold your monster if it fails!!!)
Week 4: 59

Week 1: 47

Week 2: 1-22

week 3: 0

Then Repeat the Lifespan index all over. On the second week 4, dont scold your monster because it might give it more stress than expected. If it scolding doesnt affect the monsters gained fatigue and stress, please note me.

Now is there any more mistakes?

Also scolding, I think it adds a bit stress. So since your method works with fails, you should not scold it.

By Battle Fencer on Tuesday, June 18, 2002 - 05:30 am:

I was thinking. Since some monsters are neutreal to tablet, better plump (for their high defence and life), and still have an OK speed. I'll post another method that should raise its form pretty fast.

By Battle Fencer on Tuesday, June 18, 2002 - 05:56 am:

Here it is. This works best in infancy.


Week 1: Candy = LD-10,5

Week 2: Mango = 0,5 LD-10,10

Week 3: Mango = 0,15 LD-10,20

Week 4: Mint Leaf = 10,10 LD-20,15

MEAT= 20,7

Week 1: Candy =20,5 LD-30,10

Week 2: Nut Oil =2,10 LD-12,15

Week 3: Mint Leaf =12,7 LD-22,12

Week 4: Candy =22,10 RT-0,0-5

MEAT= 0,0

Repeat...

Life Index :

Week 1: 20

Week 2: 30

Week 3: 50

Week 4: 50

Week 1: 50

Week 2: 42

Week 3: 46

Week 4: 2-10

Beggining of next Week: 0

By The D on Tuesday, June 18, 2002 - 11:28 am:

This looks like a good method to get fattend up a bit before battle... but personally I hate when my monsters get fat. I usually keep them at Slim for a boost in SPD. But for anyone wanting a little boost in DEF it seems good.

By Battle Fencer on Tuesday, June 18, 2002 - 11:52 am:

But what you do is get a monster's speed high and his defence a little lower so that when the monster is plump, it will even out and if you get hit, you have the defence to back it up.

By The D on Tuesday, June 18, 2002 - 11:56 am:

Well that works good, but I usually have DEF and SPD Maxxed along with (probably) INT maxxed. Unless I am training a Durahan(or other monster which is not to good in SPD/INT.) where I only train SPD/INT in Prime for one year using the Golden Peach.

By Battle Fencer on Wednesday, June 19, 2002 - 01:44 pm:

I've got another method that I'm going to post next that can go on without rests and still get form go up, but very slowly.

By Battle Fencer on Wednesday, June 19, 2002 - 02:05 pm:

Again, this works best at childhood and can only work with monsters liking tablets.

Week 1 | Mango = 0,0 LD = 10,5 Form = 1 Lifespan Index = 20

Week 2 | Mint Leaf = 10,2 LD = 10,2 Form = -4 Lifespan Index = 34

Week 3 | Nuts Oil = 0,7 LD = 10,12 Form = -4 Lifespan Index = 34

Week 4 | Nuts Oil = 0,12 LD = 10,17 Form = -4 Lifespan Index = 44

Tablet | 10,2

Beggining of Next Week = 10,2 Form = -1 Lifespan Index = 14

Week 1 | Candy = 10,0 LD = 20,5 Form = 8 Lifespan Index = 30

Week 2 | Nuts Oil = 0,5 LD = 10,10 Form = 8 Lifespan Index = 30

Week 3 | Mint Leaf = 10,5 LD = 20,10 Form = 3 Lifespan Index = 40

Week 4 | Nuts Oil = 0,10 LD = 10,15 Form = 3 Lifespan Index = 20

Tablet | 10,0

Beggining of Next Week = 10,0 Form = 4 Lifespan Index = 10

Repeat...
Notes: Since next week you give your monster a mango, the fatigue of your monster is going to 0.

By The D on Wednesday, June 19, 2002 - 03:01 pm:
